metadata.titel_preek: Lent and Holy Week: Ash Wednesday and First Sunday in Lent

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human condition of universal sin and self-deception to enact a salvation that humans cannot achieve for themselves.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has shown us a great thing.
There is Another who has taken the sentence upon himself.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
make a completely new person out of the sinner
the salvation of each and every one of us

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Reality of God's Holiness
tekstueel_bewijs: the holiness of God, who has the absolute right to make demands

ontvanger.identificatie: The Human Race / The 'Enemies' of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the salvation of each and every one of us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Receiver (The hearer is identified as the 'unrighteous' beneficiary)

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (as the one who takes the place)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power (implied in the prayer for a 'right spirit')

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a Cosmic Power / Self-Deception / The 'Axis of Evil' in the heart
tekstueel_bewijs: the storm of the wrath of God against sin
the line separating good and evil passes... right through every human heart
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is treated not as a mere mistake but as a condition that requires the death of the Son of God to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of repentance and 'insight' following the recognition of grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Repentance is explicitly stated as a 'response to' God's holiness and mercy, not a condition for it.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has shown us a great thing.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
God sees you as you really are, and he loves you.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We throw ourselves on his mercy.
We do not need to surround ourselves with defenses.
The psalmist demonstrated that he has learned to see sin as God sees it.

voorbeelden: Our temptation will be... to try to squirm off the hook.
The knowledge of grace has preceded the confession of sin.
God is truly able to do away with sin.
Let each one find thee mighty to save.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to save and the human 'insight' (Savoir) into that reality, rather than a moral 'obligation' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the false security of ~S1 (pretense) to the crushing reality of S2 (judgment), then through ~S2 (repentance) to the finality of S1 (grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes S2 (the storm of wrath) so that the sinner can move from ~S1 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; judgment is described as a 'storm of wrath' and a 'sentence'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the primary actor. Human action (repentance) is defined as a secondary response to a prior divine act.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The psalmist demonstrated that he has learned to see sin as God sees it.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
The knowledge of grace has preceded the confession of sin.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Psalmist and Tolkien are used as models of 'insight', but they are secondary to the work of Christ.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by focusing on God as the one who creates the clean heart.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'exhausting charade' of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where God's mercy is the only ground for hope.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the human predicament (Ash Wednesday) to the divine solution (Christ) is seamless and structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Against you only have I sinned' and the reality of hurting neighbors.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'onslaught' and a 'storm' that humans cannot survive alone.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of grace-oriented homiletics. God is the Subject, the human is the Receiver, and the Opponent is a serious cosmic force.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Savoir (Insight) and Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The definition of 'Repentance as insight' is a brilliant modal shift from Devoir to Savoir.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The 'Heavy Opponent' (wrath/sin) makes the 'Strong Subject' (Christ) necessary.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of moralism by grounding the human act of repentance in the prior, objective work of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the Tolkien anecdote's persuasiveness, semiotics reveals how Tolkien functions as a 'Helper' to the hearer's 'Savoir-faire'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Hebrew of Psalm 51; semiotics explains how the sermon's 'engine' moves the hearer from the role of 'Judge' to 'Receiver'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch': the hearer stops trying to be the Subject of their own cleansing and accepts God as the only Subject capable of it.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's grammar effectively, ensuring God is the subject of the most critical soteriological verbs.
